manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Why is Eucalan no-rinse? The formula doesn't require that it be rinsed. With your first soak in Eucalan, you should likely see the water in the wash basin turn a bit brown. The soap releases dirt into the wash basin, & though the clothing absorbs a little of the soap, it is beneficial. Lanolin fortifies & conditions clothing fibres - particularly great for woolens & knits, but can be used on most anything. Scented with only pure essential oils, some of them contain long-term cleaning properties that are intended to remain in the clothing to further benefit from; Think swim suits & lingerie that lie close to the skin, or blankets & knitted sweaters that get packed away for the cold months. Eucalan’s no-rinse formula is also convenient – great for travel when you’re not likely to have a washing machine, or are seeking to conserve water. If you feel the urge to rinse, it is safe to do so. The soap has done its job of cleaning, though you will lose the lasting effects of the lanolin & essential oils.

Lavender Essential Oil The essential oil of lavender is known for both natural fibre protection and cleaning properties, making this a versatile wash for all fibres. Lavender’s sweet soothing scent is ideal for baby items like blankets, stuffed animals, clothing, and wool diaper covers.

Lavender Delicate Wash Eucalan's Most Versatile Scent As Eucalan's most versatile scent, use it on all your delicates like baby items, sweaters, lingerie, hosiery, comforters, linens, bedding, down jackets, and bathing suits. Does one scent clean better than the other? Each scent of Eucalan launders the same, releasing dirt from the item and into the water. However, certain essential oils have different lasting benefits. Grapefruit and Lavender have unique cleaning characteristics. Lavender and Eucalyptus have properties best used on woolens and items that get stored away periodically. Our Favourite Items to Wash in Eucalan's Lavender Stuffed Animals Bedding Cashmere/ Woolens Sheepskin Nightgowns Nursing Bras Linens

Safe for Your Most Precious Possessions Bedding From handmade quilts to linen duvets, Eucalan is safe to launder all types of bedding. The soothing scent of lavender is a wonderful choice for a relaxing night of sleep in your fresh bedding. Baby Items Eucalan is a delicately mild soap, gentle enough to be the primary detergent used to care for all your babies’ favourite things. Eucalan is safe to use on baby clothing, stuffed animals, wool diaper covers, blankies, sheepskins, and even nursing bras. Eucalan's Lavender is our favourite wash for all things baby related because of its soothing and relaxing properties. Cashmere/ Woolens For woolens, no rinse is an important concept. We tend to suggest Eucalan's Lavender or Eucalyptus for the long-term, protective properties of the essential oils. As woolens tend to be packed away for the warmer seasons, treating them in Eucalan will help preserve the longevity of the fibres.

.17 oz (5mL) Pod 3.3 oz (100mL) Bottle 16.9 oz (500mL) Bottle 1 gal (4L) Jug Washes per Bottle 1-2 uses 20 hand washes 95 hand washes or 33 machine washes 760 hand washes or 253 machine washes Best for Travel, stocking stuffers, or to try out. Extended travel, paired with a hand knit gift, or expensive garment. Occasional home use or select favourite pieces. Frequent home use or refilling smaller portable bottles.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Gentle soap, lightly scented
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this because it was recommended on several knitting and crocheting sites as being good for wet blocking wool. I used a very small amount in a basin of tepid water, and it worked well. The scent is pleasant (I purchased the lavender), but VERY faint. I'm glad I bought the larger size bottle. It's a much better value, and I intend to use it to wash my woolens. I particularly like that it's very gentle and doesn't need to be rinsed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Comparison to The Laundress New York Wool and Cashmere Shampoo and Soak Wash!
reviews.reviewText: As a hand knitter, blocking is an important technique in getting your hand knitted items into a desired shape by redistributing the stitches, without stretching it out or damaging the fibers. Plain water can be used for this purpose but to keep the natural fibers soft and to preserve the natural lanolin oils found in theses fibers, a wool wash is more efficient.I have purchased and used this item, along with The Laundress Wool & Cashmere Shampoo, Cedar, 16 fl. oz. – 32 loads and Soakwash Liquid Laundry Wash, 12-Ounce, Scentless . Here is my comparison of all three items:1. Eucalan Delicate Wash Wrapture – JasmineThis is a no rinse wash that contains a touch of lanolin to naturally condition fibers. I used this wash on several Lopapeysas that I hand knitted with scratchy Icelandic wool. I simply poured about 2 capfuls per gallon of cold water and let the sweater sit overnight. I squeezed it out and laid flat to dry (on a blocking mat) the next day (shaping if necessary).This wash was perfect in softening the wool and gave it a light jasmine scent. Grade A+2. The Laundress New York Wool and Cashmere Shampoo – CedarThis is a highly concentrated wool and cashmere shampoo that contains lanolin and cedar extracts. I also used this wash on hand knitted Lopapeysas and a fisherman’s sweater for my husband. I did the same process using about 2 capfuls per gallon of cold water and let the sweater sit overnight, however, this shampoo (it’s sudsy and soapy), requires rinsing. I rinsed with cold water until it ran clear then squeezed it out and laid flat to dry (on a blocking mat) the next day (shaping if necessary).I also recommend this shampoo for washing (cleaning) wool items that have been soiled or sweaty. It works wonderfully on my husband and children’s ski wool items and base layers.This wash was perfect in softening the wool and giving it a lovely cedar “woodsy” smell that is perfect for the “manly” man yet still subtle and feminine for the “girly” girl! Grade A+3. Soak Wash for Hand Knits – ScentlessThis is a gentle no rinse formula that’s phosphate free and perfect for people with sensitive skin or sensitive noses! I use this for all my hand knitted baby and children’s items (form socks and hats to sweaters and blankets) and hand knitted items I give as gifts. I think this one would be perfect for other delicate items such as lingerie.I follow the same method, as with the other washes (soak, squeeze and rinse, lay flat to dry).This wash was perfect in providing the softness without the fragrance! Grade A+NoteI cannot comment on how any of these washes/shampoos preform on machine washed items as I’ve only done them by hand.None of my items have shrunk using any of the above washes/shampoos.I highly recommend any of the above three for your wool, cashmere, or natural fiber items!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Reliable wash for hand knits
reviews.reviewText: Works well, unscented is really unscented, and a little goes a long way.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So versatile and easy
reviews.reviewText: I recently bought this to use for my cresta wool leggings and after I washed them they were so soft and smelled so amazing. I decided to try it on my flannel shirts because washing them in regular detergent always makes them feel rough to the touch. I was absolutely thrilled at how super soft the shirts felt after washing them. I have also used it on cashmere and sherpa fleece. It works great on everything. I will never use regular laundry detergent for any of those items again.I use either the rinse cycle or the delicate cycle on my front load washer with a tsp or less of the product depending on how many and what type of items I'm washing, and it leaves everything feeling, looking and smelling amazing. I love it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Smells heavenly and cleans efficiently
reviews.reviewText: I use this mainly for washing my swimwear after a swim. It does a thorough, yet gentle, job of getting my suits clean and replacing that chlorine smell with a lovely lavender scent.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Let me settle the debate on scent
reviews.reviewText: I have a fine-tuned nose and the lavender scent IS very strong if you are the type of person (like me) who has cut any artificial fragrances or strong smells out of their home. Re: no perfume, air fresheners, fake scents in soap, detergent, etc etc. the only scents I use in products are essential oil based, which are usually pretty mild/not long lasting. If you're like me and don't use chemically-based scented products, the smell of this on your clothes may feel like a perfumey assault to the senses. I cannot imagine wearing a sweater that was washed in this. It would be way too much. I have a hard time believing the smell is ONLY lavender essential oil as they claim because it just smells well, different and more intense than lavender essential oil. And trust me, I use a lot of that stuff. I am using this cleaner for wool diaper covers and at first the smell is too much for me...I really hate that after putting a cover on my babe, my hands smell like this lavender perfume smell for a long time. And like I said, not like the fresh, simple natural lavender smell either. BUT after a week of use of the wool covers, the smell fades and I feel somewhat grateful that the wools don't stink and still smell lightly pleasant. So I do think it might masks the urine smell a bit more than unscented would...but I have only used this one so don't have a lot to compare to. My next bottle I'll probably get unscented to try it out...and maybe add my own scent. If anybody gets any info on if there truly is an additional scent added in here, I'd love to know.Update: after months of use, the smell (surprise) really doesn't bother me anymore...Not sure if I've grown accustomed to it or it's because I find I am able to use less soap than I was initially. Still liking this product, and happy that a little goes a long way with this bottle.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for hand washing and delicates
reviews.reviewText: Awesome product, perfect for delicates and no need to rinse which saves water. Smells lovely, leaves no residue. Nothing better than this.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I used this on a knitted wool shawl before blocking. The no rinse solution was easy to use, smells great, and left the shawl super soft. Highly recommend.

Ce n'est pas la 1 ère fois que je commande ce produit, il est très efficace.Mais cette fois il y a eu un problème avec la livraison, le contenant est arrivé avec le bouchon tout enfoncé et difficile à ouvrir et refermer, dommage.Pourtant l'emballage(la boîte) externe était intact mais le contenant n'était pas assez sécurisé dans la boîte, ce qui a causé le bris........ beaucoup moins pratique.

Very happy with this product! A teaspoon is all you need in a wash basin with your handwashables. It works great. No rinse needed, making it super easy! Cashmere comes out lovely & soft. The jasmine fragrance is wonderful!
Bought it to wash sheepskin saddle pads and they came out looking like new. Nice light fragrance.
I used it for a scarf that I knit. Made the scarf very a lot softer and cozier.
